exercises.name: Push-up
exercises.description: A classic bodyweight exercise for strengthening the upper body and core. The push-up involves lowering your body to the ground by bending your arms and then pushing it back up using your arms and chest muscles. It's a great exercise for building overall upper body strength and is a staple in many workout routines.

exercises.name: Squats
exercises.description: Squats are a lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. When performing squats, you lower your body by bending your knees and hips, as if you were sitting in an imaginary chair, and then return to a standing position. Squats are essential for building leg strength and are a fundamental movement in strength training.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: The plank is a core-strengthening exercise that improves stability and posture. To do a plank, you hold a push-up position with your arms straight and your body in a straight line, supported by your toes and forearms. This exercise is excellent for developing core strength, which is vital for maintaining good posture and preventing lower back pain.

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.description: Lunges are a leg exercise that works on balance and strength. To perform lunges, you step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90-degree angles. Lunges help to build leg and glute strength, improve balance, and are often used to target specific leg muscles.

exercises.name: Burpees
exercises.description: Burpees are a full-body exercise that combines strength and cardio. A burpee involves a sequence of movements, including a squat, push-up, and jump. This exercise is intense and effective for both strength training and cardiovascular conditioning, making it a popular choice for high-intensity workouts.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.description: Pull-ups are an upper body exercise that primarily targets the back and biceps. When performing pull-ups, you hang from a horizontal bar and pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. This exercise is great for building upper body and back strength and is a challenging bodyweight movement.

exercises.name: Sit-ups
exercises.description: Sit-ups are an abdominal exercise designed to strengthen the core muscles. You perform sit-ups by lying on your back, bending your knees, and lifting your upper body off the ground toward your thighs. This exercise helps build abdominal strength and is often included in core workouts.

exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.description: Jumping Jacks are a cardio exercise that increases your heart rate. This exercise involves jumping while spreading your legs and simultaneously raising your arms overhead, and then returning to the starting position. Jumping Jacks are an effective way to warm up before other exercises and improve cardiovascular fitness.

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunches
exercises.description: Bicycle Crunches are an effective core exercise that targets the oblique muscles. When performing bicycle crunches, you lie on your back, bring your knees up, and twist your upper body to touch your elbows to your knees in a pedaling motion. This exercise is great for building oblique strength and toning the abdominal muscles.
